ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (O people of Makkah), your companion is not mad;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Your companion (Muhammad) does not suffer from any mental illness
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And your companion is not insane.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And your companion is not a madman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And your companion is not gone mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And your comrade is not mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Your companion is not one possessed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And (O people!) your companion is not one possessed;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (O people) your companion (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) is not a madman;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And your companion is not [at all] mad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:22] And your companion, Muhammad (s) (wa-mā sāhibukum: a supplement to [the clause from] innahu, ‘truly this is’, up to the last of the oath clauses) is not a madman, as you claim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And your comrade) your Prophet Muhammad, Quraysh (is not mad) bewitched as you claim.
